page.title: 05Tom Bawcock's Eve(Mousehole)
page.content: About two hundred years ago, when {Mousehole}was purely a{fishing village, a man called Tom Bawcock lived there. That winter the weather was very bad and no boat had been able to leave the harbour for weeks to go {fishing.}It was nearly Christmas and the food was getting desperately short, so Tom Bawcock went out{fishing {even though}the weather was terrible. It was the only boat that went out that night. The saying goes that they caught seven types of{fish}that night. This event is still celebrated in {Mousehole}on the 23rd December when "Starry Gazy Pie" can be eaten at the "Ship Inn". This pie is so named because the{fish}heads appear above the top crust of the pie, gazing at the stars.
